results.title: Carbon-dioxide absorption technique
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of CO2, absorption techniques, and demonstrates two methods in use: Single-phase absorption and closed circuit or double-phase absorption.

results.title: Carbon
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison Associates and Peter De Normanville
results.brief_description: Shows the various forms of carbon and the familiar uses of such substances as diamond, pencil lead and charcoal. Surveys the everyday uses of carbon, both in the house and in industry, and touches on the development of pyrographite and carbon fibres. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Caravaners
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor and George Johnson
results.brief_description: The three-hundred Airstream caravans that are prowling the highways of British Columbia represent a new breed of nomad. Too active just to sit at home but too cautious to strike out on their own, these retired couples have signed up for an organized caravan tour sponsored by the company that manufactures the trailers. Few surprises are in store for the group, but then they’re never alone and they don’t have to worry about the day’s route or entertainment.

results.title: Caravan park
results.brief_description: Caravan Park is filmed both from the point of view of a small child and from an observer. A family of three is stranded in a caravan park when their car breaks down on the road home. A stray cat found near the car is taken as a good luck sign by the father and adopted by his son. As the family continues to struggle to make ends meet and get back on the road, the cat continues to be a sign of good luck for the father, until it dies. This is a slow paced narrative and requires careful examination of the characters to understand its purpose.

results.title: Caravan park
results.brief_description: When their car breaks down on the way to Queensland, a family is forced to take up residence at a caravan park while the father tries to earn enough money to get the car repaired. Much of the film is seen through the eyes of their young son as he comes to realise some of the complexities of his parents’ relationship. Great realist film from the director of ‘Patriot Games’ (1992), ‘The Bone Collector’ (1999) and ‘Rabbit-Proof Fence’ (2002). Based on the story by John Emery. Photography by Tom Cowan, editing by Anthony Buckley and production assistant, Gillian Armstrong. Original Format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: Caravaggio
results.creator_credit: BFI, Sarah Radclyffe and Derek Jarman
results.brief_description: An imaginary biopic of the Italian painter who died in 1610. Caravaggio was the last, perhaps the greatest, and certainly the most controversial painter of the Italian Renaissance. While Caravaggio’s paintings reflect an increasingly profound and original awareness, his private life was fraught with prostitutes, brawls, duels, arrests and libel cases, culminating in 1606 with a murder. Caravaggio’s bisexuality, his propensity for violence, and his scorn for court conventions made him the scoundrel of the Italian aristocracy.

results.title: Car maintenance and care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
A garage mechanic explains that a car remains attractive, economical, dependable, and safe to drive if the owner keeps the car in good condition. Discusses preventative measures to be followed: regular checking and servicing, listening for unusual sounds indicating engine trouble, checking instrument panel for warnings of trouble, rotating the tyres periodically, and driving carefully to safeguard brakes, tyres, transmission and springs.

results.title: Captured in time: favourites of the fifties from the Cinesound / Movietone newsreels.
results.creator_credit: Film World, Bluestone Productions and Norm Wilkinson
results.brief_description: Years before television bought the news into our loungeroom, the Cinesound and Movietone news delighted and informed the cinema goers of Australia. This video contains news stories from the 1950’s including Australia at war with Korea, the Redex Trial in 1955 and the filming of Neville Shute’s “On the beach” in Melbourne.
